sect2.title: What is &app;
sect2.para: Gossip is an instant messaging program for the GNOME Desktop. It allows instant communication across a network using the Jabber protocol. Gossip is written to be as simple to use as possible and to allow users of the GNOME Desktop to easily keep in touch with friends.

sect2.title: What is Jabber
sect2.para: Jabber is an open instant messaging protocol standard which allows a group of interconnected servers to pass messages to one another in a similar fashion to email.

Some features of the Jabber protocol include:
Open, Free, and Public
Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) Standard
Proven and working since 1998
Decentralized and Secure
Extensible with Custom Functionality
Flexible and can be used in Diverse situations
More information on the Jabber protocol can be found on the Website of the Jabber Software Fondation.

sect2.title: To Start &app;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para:
Choose
Internet Gossip Instant Messenger .
To start &app; from a command line, type gossip and then press Return.

sect2.title: When You Start &app; the first time
sect2.para: When you start &app; the first time, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows &app;s first start window which is a wizard to set up Gossip.

sect2.para: This window is an assistant to set up &app;. With this wizard you can set up Gossip in few steps. You can use it to get a new Jabber Account or setting up Gossip for using an existing Jabber Account.

sect2.title: Getting a Jabber Account
sect2.para: Gossip will help set up a new Jabber account:

listitem.para: When first running Gossip, answer No to the "Do you already have an account on a Jabber server?" question and click Next.
Fill in desired user name and actual name and click Next.
Add the server information.
Choose the correct server for the account from the list, or type in a custom server if needed.
Select the Use encryption (SSL) option if your server requires it.
Select the Use system proxy option if you use a proxy.
Once all options are set, click Next.
Review the information and click Apply.
When prompted on first connection with the account, enter desired password.

sect2.title: Setting up Gossip to Use an existing Jabber Account
sect2.para: Gossip will let you use an existing Jabber account:

listitem.para: When first running Gossip, answer Yes to the "Do you already have an account set up on a server?" question and click Next.
Fill in the user name of the account and click Next.
Add the server information.
Choose the correct server for the account from the list, or type in a custom server if needed.
Select the Use encryption (SSL) option if your server requires it.
Select the Use system proxy option if you use a proxy.
Once all options are set, click Next.
Review the information and click Apply.
When prompted on first connection with the account, enter desired password.

sect2.title: When You Start &app;
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows &app; main window. Contains titlebar, menubar, contact list, status icon and status drop-down list. Menubar contains Chat, Edit and Help menus.

sect2.para: The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands you needed to connect to servers and manage accounts, contacts, and preferences in &app;.
The buttons on the account toolbar allow you, depending on account state, to connect, disconnect, and edit an account.
The Contact List shows all available contacts and their assosiated statuses.
This shows the current status of the user.
You can use this selector to change your online state.

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: You can use the &app; application to perform the following tasks:

sect2.title: Connect to the Server
sect2.para:
To connect to the server, choose
Chat Connect...
from the MenuBar.

sect2.title: Disconnect from the Server
sect2.para:
To disconnect to the server, choose
Chat Disconnect
from the MenuBar.

sect2.title: Adding a Contact
sect2.para: If you add a contact to your contact list, you can see when this person is online. To add a contact, perform the following steps:

listitem.para:
Select
Chat Add Contact
from the MenuBar.
Enter the contact's Jabber ID (JID) and click Forward.

note.para: The Jabber ID looks like an email-address. Example: name@host.domain

listitem.para: Enter a desired nickname and group name for the contact. The nickname will be displayed in the Contact List under the chosen group name. Click Forward when finished.

You need the authorization from the contact, to add him or her to the Contact List. Also everybody who wants add you, needs your authorization. Enter a desired request message that will be sent to the contact and click Forward.
Review the information displayed and click Apply..
When the user has permited your request, you can see the user in your contact list as Avaible, Busyor Away.

sect2.title: Accessing a Contact's Information
sect2.para: Right Click a contact's nickname in the Contact List and select Contact Information.

sect2.title: Renaming a Contact
sect2.para: Right Click a contact's nickname in the Contact List and select Rename Contact. Enter new name and click Ok to apply, or Cancel to discard all changes.

sect2.title: Removing a Contact
sect2.para: Right Click a contact's nickname in the Contact List and select Remove Contact. Click Yes when prompted to finish removal.

sect1.title: Settings
sect1.para:
To configure &app;, choose
Edit Preferences . The Preferences dialog contains the following tabbed sections:

listitem.para: Select the Convert smileys to graphical images option, to enable graphical images.
Select the Open new chats in separate windows option, to open chats in separate windows.
Select the Play sound when messages arrive option to enable sounds.
Select the Disable sounds when busy option to disable sounds when busy.
Select the Disable sounds when away option to idsable sounds when away.
Select the languages you wish to enable for spell checking

note.para: The list of languages only reflect the languages that have a dictionary installed.

listitem.para: Select the Check spelling while I type option, to enable spell checking.
